trans-unit.source: Creates an HTML anchor link to the header/content element, e.g. "#section-of-interest". The number sign (#) will be set on the website by the system.

These anchors will be used for example by the "Section index" content elements, if available. They can help to improve the readability of a URL. By default (if no anchor is given), the unique id (integer) of the content element is used there, e.g. "#c123". Example for a URL with a human-readable anchor: https://domain.com/some-page/#section-of-interest An anchor can only contain certain characters. If you use non-supported characters, these will be removed or replaced when the content element is saved. All anchors on the same page have to be unique. If another content element already has the same anchor, your new anchor will be automatically extended with a number.

You can use the following characters in this field:

  • ASCII characters (a–z)
  • digits (0–9)
  • underscores (_)
  • hyphens (-)
  • periods (.)

When the content element is saved …

… all characters are converted to lowercase.
… HTML elements are removed completely.
… space characters are converted to the hyphen character.
… special characters (e.g. äöüß€) are converted to ASCII equivalents.
